intro: Faberiopsis, commonly known as the Chinese broomrape, is a parasitic plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It lacks chlorophyll and relies entirely on its host for nutrients, typically attaching to the roots of other plants. Faberiopsis species are often found in arid and semi-arid regions, particularly in China and the Himalayas. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or yellow in color. Due to its parasitic nature, it plays a unique role in ecosystem dynamics, though it can be a concern for agricultural crops.
